trans-unit.source: Unlocks a region in an open file

target.mrk: Unlocks a region in an open file

trans-unit.source: Handle to the file that contains a region locked with _WinAPI_LockFile() function.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the file that contains a region locked with _WinAPI_LockFile() function.

target.mrk: Handle to the file that contains a region locked with _WinAPI_LockFile() function.

trans-unit.source: The starting byte offset in the file where the locked region begins.

seg-source.mrk: The starting byte offset in the file where the locked region begins.

target.mrk: The starting byte offset in the file where the locked region begins.

trans-unit.source: The length of the byte range to be unlocked.

seg-source.mrk: The length of the byte range to be unlocked.

target.mrk: The length of the byte range to be unlocked.

trans-unit.source: Unlocking a region of a file releases a previously acquired lock on the file. The region to unlock must correspond

seg-source.mrk: Unlocking a region of a file releases a previously acquired lock on the file.
The region to unlock must correspond

target.mrk: Unlocking a region of a file releases a previously acquired lock on the file.
The region to unlock must correspond

trans-unit.source: exactly to an existing locked region. Two adjacent regions of a file cannot be locked separately and then unlocked

seg-source.mrk: exactly to an existing locked region.
Two adjacent regions of a file cannot be locked separately and then unlocked

target.mrk: exactly to an existing locked region.
Two adjacent regions of a file cannot be locked separately and then unlocked

trans-unit.source: using a single region that spans both locked regions.

seg-source.mrk: using a single region that spans both locked regions.

target.mrk: using a single region that spans both locked regions.
